Key Match Events: Tobias Harris had 24 points and 10 rebounds as the Detroit Pistons held off the Charlotte Hornets 98-94.
Cade Cunningham added 18 points for the Pistons, while Jalen Duren had 10 points and 14 rebounds.
Miles Bridges had 20 points and Mark Williams scored 18 for Charlotte.
The Pistons outscored Charlotte 14-12 in the fourth quarter, hitting 30% of their shots while Charlotte went 4 for 19.
Charlotte started the fourth period by missing 11 of its first 12 shots and committing five turnovers.
The Pistons built a 92-85 lead with 4:30 to play.
Charlotte only made two of their first seven free throws in the fourth quarter.
The Pistons were down 47-46 with 4:45 left in the second quarter, and Charlotte went on an 11-2 run before Bridges ended the half with a 30-foot 3-pointer to make it 65-52.
The Pistons came back to outscore the Hornets 32-17 in the third quarter.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Charlotte only got nine offensive rebounds to Detroit's 14.
Detroit played its first game since Jaden Ivey broke his left leg in Wednesday's win over Orlando.
Wendell Moore Jr. started at shooting guard but didn't score in 15 minutes.
Malik Beasley got most of the playing time, scoring 12 points in 31 minutes.
Charlotte was forced to foul three times in the final minute but missed 11 of 30 free throws.
